abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mainstreaming
            Market-Based Instruments for Environmental Management
            Project for Costa Rica as follows: GEO outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to GEO outcome was
            negligible to low, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            project design and implementation need to acknowledge
            country-specific complexities and pay particular attention
            to project readiness prior to appraisal. Delays in
            effectiveness can lead to a situation where the project
            design is not aligned anymore to the situation on the
            ground. Where project effectiveness is delayed, the validity
            of assumptions made at appraisal needs to be reviewed, and
            corrective action taken as early as possible upon
            effectiveness. While ecological baselines are not always
            readily at hand, science offers a number of alternatives for
            properly measuring conservation achievements when data is
            difficult to obtain or not available. Only biodiversity
            operations and/or components that incorporate simple, but
            proven data collection and measurement tools will ultimately
            be able to deliver on the outcomes expected from such
            programs in the long term. To ensure that a projects
            Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework serves its
            purpose as a project management tool, relevant project
            stakeholders need to adequately understand its concepts and
            display the capacity to ensure appropriate implementation.
            Where this is not the case, these deficiencies need to be
            identified and addressed as a matter of priority. This could
            be done by either providing additional technical assistance
            to the implementation agency or, in circumstances where
            better suited capacity is available outside, bringing this
            expertise into the project at the design stage.
